intro: Stenomesson weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's stenomesson, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and is adapted to the cool, temperate climate of its native habitat. Its leaves are often lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
